review_title: Klein Center-Where the residents deserve better
job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in West Burlington, CO
pros: I worked at GRHS'S Nursing Home. For appearances it has a much more home like appeal than other places. I loved working with the residents and seeing when they felt cared for and appreciated.
cons: The care center's administration is not what I'd call empoyee friendly. The staff consists of the "lifers" and the "in-and-outs".  The lifers seem to get away with behaviors, such as saying very negative and even mean things about the residents in the facility's public spaces or being rude and disrespecting to their coworkers. Staffing information and training  is a complete mess. Things you should be informed of from day one are not given until there is an issue and even then they will put the onus on the employer, including lying about their part in a given negative situation. Administration will then act in an unprofessional manner that could be construed as retaliatory when it is brought to their attention, especially if you go over them to HR. Basically, you are expected to be a puppet on their strings, willing to rat out fellow employees, and voicing no opinions of your own to management. Oh and they'll try to get away with having phone meetings on your non-work time and scheduling you last minute to fill the massive number of holes they have in staffing.

job_title: Certified Nurse Assistant in West Burlington, IA
pros: GRMC is a state of the art facility.  We have excellant physicians. The building is only 8 years old. We have been showcased for our stroke and heart attack programs. We have a new Heart and Vascular unit. Our in-patient and out patient rehab units are top notch.
cons: The Matrix for staffing the units is all wrong. Long term CNA's need to be advanced in pay like everyone else instead of capped out because of their senority. 2-3 % raise a year is not much when there are new RN's that make 30 plus dollars an hour. The corporation needs to stand behind there employee when they need financial help.

review_title: Good company if not in IT
job_title: IT Department in West Burlington, IA
pros: Stable company. Great, compassionate and caring Senior Management team. Company overall is great.  IT department is where the issues are.
cons: Nowhere to go in IT. No growth or advancement opportunities. Pay is inferior. IT not well respected in the organization. IT leadership very stifling and does not show appreciation.  Do not feel valued.  Continued education is virtually nonexistent. No standards or policies, every request is handled on a case by case basis. IT has good old boys club mentality. Much favoritism even with filling open positions.
